title: Chelsea identify Kalidou Koulibaly as No1 target? Transfer news and gossip from Thursday's papers
text:
Sport Chelsea identify Kalidou Koulibaly as No1 target? Transfer news and gossip from Thursday's papers PLUS: Chelsea will sell Costa if they can sign Morata and Lukaku, while Liverpool are tracking Timo Werner Share Kalidou Koulibaly dis reportedly Chelsea's top summer target (Photo: Getty) Share Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Chelsea manager Antonio Conte has identified Napoli's Kalidou Koulibaly as his top priority target for the summer, according to reports from Italy. 
The former Juventus boss is a long-term admirer of the talented centre-back and tried to bring him to Stamford Bridge last summer ahead of his maiden campaign with the club. 
And according to the Italian site TuttoMercatoWeb , the Senegalese international has been earmarked as John Terry's successor, should the former England captain finally call time on his illustrious career with the Blues. 
Koulibaly has been one of Napoli's top performers since moving to Serie A from Belgian outfit Genk three years ago, first turning Conte's head during his tenure with the reigning Italian champions. The Senegal international has impressed in three seasons with Napoli (Photo: AFP) Top stories from the Daily Mirror 
Staying with Lukaku, the wantaway Toffee has h inted that a lack of ambition by Everton in the transfer window are behind his desire to leave the club, intimating that there were players he knew the club 'could have got and they didn't'. 
Chelsea are considering a shock £100million swoop on Everton for both striker Romelu Lukaku AND midfielder Ross Barkley. Read More Chelsea are interested in Romelu Lukaku AND Ross Barkley (Photo: Clive Brunskill) Read More 
Liverpool face stiff competition from Bayern Munich for £20million-rated Bayer Leverkusen winger Julian Brandt . 
West Ham manager Slaven Bilic has added Sampdoria's Luis Muriel to his summer shopping list after the Colombian international hit 10 goals and nine assists in Serie A so far this season. 
Stoke's on-loan defender Bruno Martins Indi says he is keen to stay with the Potters after the end of his season-long loan from Porto and has revealed that talks with the club are underway. 
Crystal Palace keeper Steve Mandanda has taken to Facebook to deny he is in talks to return to Marseille, the French club he left to join the Eagles last summer. Steve Mandanda quashes rumours he's planning to return to Marseille (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Transfer news from other newspapers and websites 
Chelsea are ready to sell Diego Costa this summer, but only if they can sign Romelu Lukaku from Everton AND Real Madrid's Alvaro Morata (Sun). 
Bayern Munich charged down a huge bid of £56 million for Franck Ribery back in 2008, after Chelsea offered the cash and right-back Jose Bosingwa to try and lure the Frenchman (Express). Chelsea tried to sign Franck Ribery in 2008 with an audacious bid (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
Liverpool will tie down promising starlet Ryan Kent to an improved deal in the face of interest from Bournemouth and Leeds (Sun). 
The Reds are keeping tabs on promising RB Leipzig striker Timo Werner and have sent scouts to watch him on numerous occasions over the last year (Daily Mail). poll loading Will Conte get his top targets this summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
